dens  in  order  to  enhance  the  societal  standing  of  their  ethnic  groups.
Second,  preferential  programs  may  only  reinforce  common  stereotypes
holding that certain groups are unable to achieve success without special
protection based on a factor having no relationship to individual worth. . . .
Third, there is a measure of inequity in forcing innocent persons in respon-
dent’s position to bear the burdens of redressing grievances not of their
making.
